intro: Odontites gonzaloi, commonly known as the Galician toothed grass, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in mountainous regions. It is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
